item.description:
It's going to be a gorgeous afternoon. Anyone up for a loop hike to an overlook of the Quabbin called Soapstone Hill?
Guessing this to be a 2-2 1/2 hours, possibly 3 hour jaunt of approximately 5-6 miles. Microspikes or other traction device is required as there may be icy areas.This is combination of wooded trails, a ridge trail and some quabbin roads, some partially paved, some gravel. The steepest terrain is the descend from or to Soapstone Hill, whichever way we chose to hike. Part of this hike runs right along the open quabbin waters. Although the temperatures should be in high 30's, wind gusts may be high at times tomorrow afternoon so please dress accordingly.

Will be meeting at the Women's Federated Forest. Parking is limited and several miles in off the main road.

Sorry, no pets are allowed in the Quabbin even though they are allowed at the Women's Federated Forest.

Sign is small so be sure to look for it near the New Salem, Petersham line on rt 122.

My track phone: 413.559.0192

Federated Women's Club State Forest

New Salem Rd. (Rte. 122), Petersham, MA
(978) 544-3939, (978) 544-7745

Numerous trails, one to an overlook of Quabbin Reservoir, plus primitive camping (see camping section).
Description:

With over 1,000 acres, this forest extends the lands that protect the Quabbin Reservoir; tent campers can stay here (with a permit from Dennison Lake Recreation Area, 978-939-8962) as they explore the reservoir. The camping area, in fact, lies very near Gate 36, the trail through which leads directly to the shore. There’s much to explore in the state forest as well, however - a very scenic drive or hike on State Forest Rd. along Fever Brook and other, unmarked trails to the boulder-strewn Gorge and to the summit of Soapstone Hill, with a wonderful view of the Quabbin. As its name implies, this land was purchased by the Massachusetts State Federation of Women’s Club and then given to the Commonwealth.
Directions:

From Petersham Center go south on South Main St. 0.4 mi., turn right on New Salem Road (Rte. 122) 3.6 mi. to entrance on left.

 

The forest is located in mid-central Massachusetts.

  • Drive 3.6 miles on Rt. 122 south to State Forest Rd. on the right.
  • Take this right and follow for 1.7 miles to the gated park entrance. (See Erving State Forest for vehicle access).
